standards.description: Count to 100 by ones and by tens
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Know number names and the count sequence. Count to 100 by ones and by tens.

standards.description: Use addition and subtraction within 20 to solve word problems
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Use addition and subtraction within 20 to solve word problems involving situations of adding to, taking from, putting together, taking apart, and comparing.

standards.description: Understand a fraction 1/b as the quantity formed by 1 part when a whole is partitioned into b equal parts
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Understand a fraction 1/b as the quantity formed by 1 part when a whole is partitioned into b equal parts; understand a fraction a/b as the quantity formed by a parts of size 1/b.

standards.description: Apply the area and perimeter formulas for rectangles in real-world and mathematical problems
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Apply the area and perimeter formulas for rectangles in real-world and mathematical problems.

standards.description: Add and subtract fractions with unlike denominators
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Add and subtract fractions with unlike denominators (including mixed numbers) by replacing given fractions with equivalent fractions.

standards.description: Understand the concept of a ratio and use ratio language
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Understand the concept of a ratio and use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities.

standards.description: Know the formulas for the area and circumference of a circle
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Know the formulas for the area and circumference of a circle and solve problems; give an informal derivation of the relationship between the circumference and area of a circle.

standards.description: Solve linear equations in one variable
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Solve linear equations in one variable, including equations with the variable on both sides.

standards.description: Interpret expressions that represent a quantity in terms of its context
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: Interpret expressions that represent a quantity in terms of its context. Interpret parts of an expression, such as terms, factors, and coefficients.

standards.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

standards.description: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of a text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

standards.description: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information.

standards.description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

standards.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence.

standards.description: Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says
standards.subject: English Language Arts
standards.full_text: Cite strong and thorough textual evidence to support analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text, including determining where the text leaves matters uncertain.

standards.description: Use materials to design a solution to a human problem by mimicking how plants and/or animals use their external parts
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Use materials to design a solution to a human problem by mimicking how plants and/or animals use their external parts to help them survive, grow, and meet their needs.

standards.description: Construct an argument with evidence that in a particular habitat some organisms can survive well, some survive less well, and some cannot survive at all
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Construct an argument with evidence that in a particular habitat some organisms can survive well, some survive less well, and some cannot survive at all.

standards.description: Make observations and measurements to identify materials based on their properties
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Make observations and measurements to identify materials based on their properties.

standards.description: Construct a scientific explanation based on evidence from rock strata for how the geologic time scale is used
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Construct a scientific explanation based on evidence from rock strata for how the geologic time scale is used to organize Earth's 4.6-billion-year-old history.

standards.description: Construct a scientific explanation based on evidence for how environmental and genetic factors influence the growth of organisms
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Construct a scientific explanation based on evidence for how environmental and genetic factors influence the growth of organisms.

standards.description: Analyze and interpret data on the properties of substances before and after the substances interact
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Analyze and interpret data on the properties of substances before and after the substances interact to determine if a chemical reaction has occurred.

standards.description: Construct an explanation based on evidence for how the structure of DNA determines the structure of proteins
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: Construct an explanation based on evidence for how the structure of DNA determines the structure of proteins, which carry out the essential functions of life through systems of specialized cells.

standards.description: Identify geographical features in their local region
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Identify geographical features in their local region (e.g., deserts, mountains, valleys, hills, coastal areas, oceans, lakes).

standards.description: Identify the state capital, the three largest cities, and explain the geographic and economic reasons for their locations
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Identify the state capital, the three largest cities in California, and explain the geographic and economic reasons for the locations of each.

standards.description: Discuss the principles of the Magna Carta, the English Bill of Rights, and the American Bill of Rights
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Discuss the principles of the Magna Carta, the English Bill of Rights (1689), the American Declaration of Independence (1776), the French Declaration of the Rights of Man and the Citizen (1789), and the U.S. Bill of Rights (1791).

standards.description: Describe the hunter-gatherer societies including the development of tools and the use of fire
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Describe the hunter-gatherer societies, including the development of tools and the use of fire.

standards.description: Know the great voyages of discovery, the locations of the routes, and the influence of cartography
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Know the great voyages of discovery, the locations of the routes, and the influence of cartography in the development of a new European worldview.

standards.description: Describe the relationship between the moral and political ideas of the Great Awakening and the development of revolutionary fervor
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Describe the relationship between the moral and political ideas of the Great Awakening and the development of revolutionary fervor.

standards.description: Describe the Enlightenment and the rise of democratic ideas as the context in which the nation was founded
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Describe the Enlightenment and the rise of democratic ideas as the context in which the nation was founded.

standards.description: Analyze the influence of ancient Greek, Roman, English, and leading European political thinkers on the development of American government
standards.subject: Social Studies
standards.full_text: Analyze the influence of ancient Greek, Roman, English, and leading European political thinkers such as John Locke, Charles-Louis Montesquieu, Niccolo Machiavelli, and William Blackstone on the development of American government.
